intro: Plumbagidium, commonly known as sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plumbaginaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy environments. They are characterized by their blue or violet flowers and often have a striking appearance with their silver or blue-gray foliage. The genus includes several species, many of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Plumbagidium species are generally hardy and can thrive in well-drained soils.
